title: Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
text: documenting R functions roxygen2, use [] syntax create cross-references documentation:

title: Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
text: [function_name()] - Link function package [pkg::function_name()] - Link function another package [topic] - Link topic/object package [pkg::topic] - Link topic/object another package

title: Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
text: [NULL] - Creates cross-reference NULL object documentation [data.frame] - Creates cross-reference data.frame documentation [testthat::expect_snapshot_file()] - Links testthat’s expect_snapshot_file function

title: Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
text: Always use cross-reference syntax return values documented objects: : [NULL] syntax creates proper link NULL documentation, backticks just format code without creating link.

title: Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
Copilot Instructions for snapr Package
text: package uses roxygen2 markdown enabled (see DESCRIPTION file: Roxygen: list(markdown = TRUE)). means can use: - Markdown formatting documentation - [] cross-references - ` inline code - Markdown lists, headers, etc.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal snapr provide convenient snapshot testing functions R packages: expect_snapshot_data() - data.frames (adapted permission {ssdtools} package) expect_snapshot_object() - generalizes expect_snapshot_data() use R object

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version snapr GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(snapr)  # In a testthat test file: test_that("iris data is correct", {   expect_snapshot_data(iris[1:5, ], name = "iris_sample") })

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(snapr)  # Snapshot a list (RDS format by default - works for any R object) test_that("config object is correct", {   config <- list(     name = "my_app",     version = "1.0.0",     settings = list(debug = TRUE, timeout = 30)   )   expect_snapshot_object(config, name = "config") })  # Snapshot with JSON format for human-readable diffs test_that("simple data is correct", {   data <- list(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5])   expect_snapshot_object(data, name = "simple_data", writer = save_json) })  # Snapshot a model (use RDS for complex objects) test_that("model structure is correct", {   model <- lm(mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars)   expect_snapshot_object(model, name = "model") })

title: Snapshot testing for data.frames — expect_snapshot_data
Snapshot testing for data.frames — expect_snapshot_data
Snapshot testing for data.frames — expect_snapshot_data
text: x data.frame snapshot name character snapshot name digits integer passed signif() numeric variables ... Arguments passed testthat::expect_snapshot_file path Path file. name Snapshot name, taken path default. compare function used compare snapshot files.

title: Snapshot testing for data.frames — expect_snapshot_data

what: Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
title: Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
text: flexible wrapper around testthat::expect_snapshot_file() allows snapshotting R object, just data.frames. function provides convenient interface snapshot testing sensible defaults serialization.

title: Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
text: x R object snapshot. Can R object including lists, models, data.frames, vectors, etc. name character snapshot name (file extension added automatically) writer function Function write object file. Default save_rds(). options include save_json(), save_deparse(), save_csv(). Custom writer functions accept x return file path. ... Arguments passed testthat::expect_snapshot_file cran expectations verified CRAN? default, , snapshot tests tend fragile often rely minor details dependencies. compare function used compare old new results. Defaults compare_file_binary(), compares files line--line. compare binary files byte--byte, use compare_file_binary(). variant -NULL, results saved _snaps/{variant}/{test}/{name}. allows create variants experiments, results different different operating systems. Snapshot variant set local_reproducible_output() function friends. developing package can set tests/testthat/helper.R file.

title: Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
Snapshot testing for R objects — expect_snapshot_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Snapshot a list (using RDS format by default) expect_snapshot_object(list(a = 1, b = 2, c = "text"), name = "config")  # Snapshot a model model <- lm(mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars) expect_snapshot_object(model, name = "model")  # Snapshot with JSON format (for human-readable diffs) expect_snapshot_object(iris[1:5, ], name = "iris_sample", writer = save_json)  # Snapshot with deparse format expect_snapshot_object(list(x = 1:5), name = "simple_list", writer = save_deparse) } # }
